result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn M Feuker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  No narcotics even with a prescription.

Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Sentencing hearing on October 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Shawn M Feuker in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
State's Offer:  Plea to count 2 and two added counts of DC/DA.  Will rec probation.
Plea - Cts. 2,4,5 - 
BTC:  Cts. 2,4,5 - GUILTY.  Cts. 1&3 - DRI.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  **AMENDED 5/29/2014 Third party contact with victim for purpose of managing business as well as phone contact with children.

AMENDED 07-28-2014. DEFENDANT MAY HAVE EMAIL CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM IN REGARDS TO THE BUSINESS AND THE CHILDREN. THE DEFENDANT MAY HAVE SUPERVISED CONTACT WITH THE CHILDREN. FAMILY COURT MAY MODIFY THAT CONDITION AS THEY SEE FIT. DEFENDANT IS TO COMPLY WITH ALL FAMILY COURT ORDERS.
Status conference on August 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Shawn M Feuker in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Victim is present. Defense is asking the Court to defer to the family court orders as far as contact with the children. The State indicates that victim is alright with supervised visitation but that isn't how the family court order reads. The State also indicates that the victim asks the Court to allow email contact with the deft regarding the business they own jointly.

BTC: Bond may be modified to allow the defendant and victim to have email contact in regards to their business and the children. Defendant may have supervised contact with the children subject to modification by the family court as they see fit. Defendant is to comply with family court orders.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.
